President Biden signed the "Memorandum on Protecting Women's Health at Home and Abroad" on January 28, 2021, which reversed the Mexico City Policy (also known as the "global gag rule"). This executive action restored U.S. funding for international organizations that provide abortion services or information.

News: In 2021, an executive order from President Joe Biden was implemented, allowing for U.S. financial support of abortion services in foreign countries.
Raw_Response: 1. True. President Biden signed an executive order in January 2021 that reversed the "Mexico City Policy" (also known as the Global Gag Rule), which had banned U.S. funding for foreign organizations that provide abortion services or information. This action restored U.S. funding for international health organizations that offer abortion-related services.

News: President Joe Biden approved an executive order in 2021 that enables U.S. funding for abortion procedures abroad.
Raw_Response: 1. This statement is True. In January 2021, President Biden signed an executive order repealing the Mexico City Policy (also known as the "Global Gag Rule"), which had prohibited U.S. foreign aid to organizations that provide or promote abortion services abroad. This reversal allows U.S. funding to support international organizations that include abortion services in their healthcare programs.
